And while pubs and restaurants reopened in England earlier this month, the local authorities will be granted new powers to close them when coronavirus cases flare.

title: Variety: Acrostic
description: A witty guest star joins Emily Cox and Henry Rathvon and asks, “What’s so funny?”
content: ACROSTIC — The acrostic puzzle, nee “Double-Crostic,” has appeared regularly in The New York Times since 1943. It’s a bit unsung, if you will, compared with its more mainstream relative, the crossword, but its fans are passionate and the puzzle itself is smart and fun. Over all those years, there have been only five people responsible for its creation, and the most recent two work as a team. It’s remarkable for us to introduce a fresh new voice to the vaunted genre, then — let alone a voice that you may find familiar.
